attribute.name: root
attribute.tooltip: Returns the 'program' joinpoint

attribute.name: ancestor
attribute.tooltip: Looks for an ancestor joinpoint name, walking back on the AST

attribute.name: descendants
attribute.tooltip: Retrieves all descendants of the join point

attribute.name: descendants
attribute.tooltip: Retrieves the descendants of the given type

attribute.name: descendantsAndSelf
attribute.tooltip: Retrieves the descendants of the given type, including the node itself

attribute.name: chainAncestor
attribute.tooltip: Looks for an ancestor joinpoint name, walking back on the joinpoint chain

attribute.name: astAncestor
attribute.tooltip: Looks for an ancestor AST name, walking back on the AST

attribute.name: firstJp
attribute.tooltip: Looks in the descendants for the first node of the given type

attribute.name: line
attribute.tooltip: The starting line of the current node in the original code

attribute.name: column
attribute.tooltip: The starting column of the current node in the original code

attribute.name: endLine
attribute.tooltip: The ending line of the current node in the original code

attribute.name: endColumn
attribute.tooltip: The ending column of the current node in the original code

attribute.name: astNumChildren
attribute.tooltip: Returns the number of children of the node, considering null nodes

attribute.name: astChildren
attribute.tooltip: Returns an array with the children of the node, considering null nodes

attribute.name: astChild
attribute.tooltip: Returns the child of the node at the given index, considering null nodes

attribute.name: numChildren
attribute.tooltip: Returns the number of children of the node, ignoring null nodes

attribute.name: children
attribute.tooltip: Returns an array with the children of the node, ignoring null nodes

attribute.name: child
attribute.tooltip: Returns the child of the node at the given index, ignoring null nodes

attribute.name: hasNode
attribute.tooltip: true, if the given join point or AST node is the same (== test) as the current join point AST node

attribute.name: pragmas
attribute.tooltip: The pragmas associated with this node

attribute.name: data
attribute.tooltip: JS object with the parsed data of #pragma clava data, associated with this node

attribute.name: keys
attribute.tooltip: A list of the properties currently supported by this node

attribute.name: getValue
attribute.tooltip: The value associated with the given property key

attribute.name: keyType
attribute.tooltip: Java Class instance with the type of the given key

attribute.name: isMacro
attribute.tooltip: true if any descendant or the node itself was defined as a macro

attribute.name: isCxx
attribute.tooltip: true if the program was compiled with a C++ standard

attribute.name: standard
attribute.tooltip: The name of the standard (e.g., c99, c++11)

attribute.name: stdFlag
attribute.tooltip: The flag of the standard (e.g., -std=c++11)

attribute.name: extraSources
attribute.tooltip: paths to sources that the current program depends on

attribute.name: extraIncludes
attribute.tooltip: paths to includes that the current program depends on

attribute.name: name
attribute.tooltip: the name of the file

attribute.name: hasMain
attribute.tooltip: true if this file contains a 'main' method

attribute.name: path
attribute.tooltip: the folder of the source file

attribute.name: filepath
attribute.tooltip: the complete path to the file

attribute.name: relativeFilepath
attribute.tooltip: the path to the file relative to the base source path

attribute.name: relativeFolderpath
attribute.tooltip: the path to the folder of the source file relative to the base source path

attribute.name: baseSourcePath
attribute.tooltip: the path to the source folder that was given as the base folder of this file

attribute.name: isCxx
attribute.tooltip: true if this file is considered a C++ file

attribute.name: isHeader
attribute.tooltip: true if this file is considered a header file

attribute.name: isOpenCL
attribute.tooltip: true if this file is an OpenCL filetype

attribute.name: destinationFilepath
attribute.tooltip: the complete path to the file that will be generated by the weaver

attribute.name: destinationFilepath
attribute.tooltip: the complete path to the generated file, given a destination folder

attribute.name: name
attribute.tooltip: the name of the include

attribute.name: isAngled
attribute.tooltip: true if this is an angled include (i.e., system include)

attribute.name: filepath
attribute.tooltip: the complete path to the file

attribute.name: relativeFolderpath
attribute.tooltip: the path to the folder of the source file of the include, relative to the name of the include

attribute.name: id
attribute.tooltip: Uniquely identifies the loop inside the program

attribute.name: isInterchangeable
attribute.tooltip: Tests whether the loops are interchangeable. This is a conservative test.

attribute.name: init
attribute.tooltip: The statement of the loop initialization

attribute.name: initValue
attribute.tooltip: The expression of the first value of the control variable (e.g. '0' in 'size_t i = 0;')

attribute.name: endValue
attribute.tooltip: The expression of the last value of the control variable (e.g. 'length' in 'i < length;')

attribute.name: stepValue
attribute.tooltip: The expression of the iteration step

attribute.name: hasCondRelation
attribute.tooltip: True if the condition of the loop in the canonical format, and is one of: <, <=, >, >=

attribute.name: naked
attribute.tooltip: true if the scope does not have curly braces

attribute.name: owner
attribute.tooltip: The statement that owns the scope (e.g., function, loop...)

attribute.name: isFunctionArgument
attribute.tooltip: true if the expression is part of an argument of a function call

attribute.name: implicitCast
attribute.tooltip: returns a cast joinpoint if this expression has an associated implicit cast, undefined otherwise

attribute.name: decl
attribute.tooltip: a 'function' join point that represents the function declaration or definition of the call, whatever appears first; 'undefined' if nothing was found

attribute.name: declaration
attribute.tooltip: a 'function' join point that represents the function declaration of the call; 'undefined' if no declaration was found

attribute.name: definition
attribute.tooltip: a 'function' join point that represents the function definition of the call; 'undefined' if no definition was found

attribute.name: argList
attribute.tooltip: an alias for 'args'

attribute.name: args
attribute.tooltip: an array with the arguments of the call

attribute.name: returnType
attribute.tooltip: the return type of the call

attribute.name: functionType
attribute.tooltip: the function type of the call, which includes the return type and the types of the parameters

attribute.name: function
attribute.tooltip: a function join point associated with this call. No guarantees are made regarding if it is the declaration or definition of the function.

attribute.name: signature
attribute.tooltip: similar to $function.signature, but if no function decl could be found (e.g., function from system include), returns a signature based on just the name of the function

attribute.name: hasInit
attribute.tooltip: true, if vardecl has an initialization value

attribute.name: init
attribute.tooltip: If vardecl has an initialization value, returns an expression with that value

attribute.name: initStyle
attribute.tooltip: The initialization style of this vardecl

attribute.name: isParam
attribute.tooltip: true, if vardecl is a function parameter

attribute.name: isGlobal
attribute.tooltip: true, if this variable does not have local storage. This includes all global variables as well as static variables declared within a function.

attribute.name: useExpr
attribute.tooltip: expression from where the attribute 'use' is calculated. In certain cases (e.g., array access, pointer dereference) the 'use' attribute is not calculated on the node itself, but on an ancestor of the node. This attribute returns that node

attribute.name: isFunctionCall
attribute.tooltip: true if this varref represents a function call

attribute.name: signature
attribute.tooltip: a string with the signature of this function (e.g., name of the function, plus the parameters types)

attribute.name: contents
attribute.tooltip: A scope, associated with this marker

attribute.name: id
attribute.tooltip: The ID of the pragma

attribute.name: isImplicitCast
attribute.tooltip: [DEPRECATED] Use expr.implicitCast instead

attribute.name: arrayVar
attribute.tooltip: expression representing the variable of the array access (can be a varref, memberAccess...)

attribute.name: subscript
attribute.tooltip: expression of the array access subscript

attribute.name: base
attribute.tooltip: expression of the base of this member access

attribute.name: unwrap
attribute.tooltip: If the type encapsulates another type, returns the encapsulated type

attribute.name: normalize
attribute.tooltip: Ignores certain types (e.g., DecayedType)

attribute.name: pointerLevels
attribute.tooltip: Number of pointer levels from this pointer

attribute.name: isInteger
attribute.tooltip: true, if it is an integer type

attribute.name: isFloat
attribute.tooltip: true, if ot is a floating type (e.g., float, double)

attribute.name: isSigned
attribute.tooltip: true, if it is a signed integer type

attribute.name: isUnsigned
attribute.tooltip: true, if it is an unsigned integer type

attribute.name: kind
attribute.tooltip: The kind of the directive

attribute.name: numThreads
attribute.tooltip: An integer expression, or undefined if no 'num_threads' clause is defined

attribute.name: procBind
attribute.tooltip: One of 'master', 'close' or 'spread', or undefined if no 'proc_bind' clause is defined

attribute.name: private
attribute.tooltip: The variable names of all private clauses, or empty array if no private clause is defined

attribute.name: hasClause
attribute.tooltip: True if the directive has at least one clause of the given clause kind, false otherwise

attribute.name: isClauseLegal
attribute.tooltip: True if it is legal to use the given clause kind in this directive, false otherwise

attribute.name: clauseKinds
attribute.tooltip: The names of the kinds of all clauses in the pragma, or empty array if no clause is defined

attribute.name: reduction
attribute.tooltip: The variable names for the given reduction kind, or empty array if no reduction of that kind is defined

attribute.name: reductionKinds
attribute.tooltip: The reduction kinds in the reductions clauses of the this pragma, or empty array if no reduction is defined

attribute.name: default
attribute.tooltip: One of 'shared' or 'none', or undefined if no 'default' clause is defined

attribute.name: firstprivate
attribute.tooltip: The variable names of all firstprivate clauses, or empty array if no firstprivate clause is defined

attribute.name: lastprivate
attribute.tooltip: The variable names of all lastprivate clauses, or empty array if no lastprivate clause is defined

attribute.name: shared
attribute.tooltip: The variable names of all shared clauses, or empty array if no shared clause is defined

attribute.name: copyin
attribute.tooltip: The variable names of all copyin clauses, or empty array if no copyin clause is defined

attribute.name: scheduleKind
attribute.tooltip: One of 'static', 'dynamic', 'guided', 'auto' or 'runtime', or undefined if no 'schedule' clause is defined

attribute.name: scheduleChunkSize
attribute.tooltip: An integer expression, or undefined if no 'schedule' clause with chunk size is defined

attribute.name: scheduleModifiers
attribute.tooltip: A list with possible values of 'monotonic', 'nonmonotonic' or 'simd', or undefined if no 'schedule' clause with modifiers is defined

attribute.name: collapse
attribute.tooltip: An integer expression, or undefined if no 'collapse' clause is defined

attribute.name: ordered
attribute.tooltip: An integer expression, or undefined if no 'ordered' clause with a parameter is defined
